{"id":"172338516139198_706296322743412","from":{"name":"Abdo Magdy","id":"10154407181291167"},"message":"Guys,

What's the best self hosted script to run email marketing campaigns, we all know MailChimp, CampaignMonitor .etc which gets freaking expensive if you have a lot of subscribers, we used this simple script http://codecanyon.net/item/newsletter-system/52667 but it was very very elementary with few tracking options.

I'm looking for a self-hosted email newsletter system with a bit more advanced options that preferably can work with Wordpress.

This seems like a hot option:
http://codecanyon.net/item/mymail-email-newsletter-plugin-for-wordpress/3078294

What do you think?","caption":"codecanyon.net","description":"PHP Open Source Newsletter System Easy to use newsletter system written in PHP . Heaps of features which allow you to quickly send professional newsletters to your member database. D...","created_time":"2014-02-25T17:03:29+11:00","total_likes":0,"total_comments":2}

{"id":"172338516139198_707123332660711","from":{"name":"Mohamed Alaa El Din","id":"1252478278163674"},"message":"Maximum concurrent Socket.IO connections

This article may help you along the way: http://drewww.github.io/socket.io-benchmarking/

I wondered the same question, so I ended up writing a small test (using XHR-polling) to see when the connections started to fail (or fall behind). I found (in my case) that the sockets started acting up at around 1400-1800 concurrent connections.

This is a short gist to the test: https://gist.github.com/jmyrland/5535279","caption":"drewww.github.io","description":"I've had lots of fun making prototypes in nodejs with socket.io. But I've felt lost in thinking about the performance of the server if I ever needed to scale something up. What operations, exactly, are costly? What is the bottleneck in performance? A few potential limiting factors came to mind:","created_time":"2014-02-27T05:35:42+11:00","total_likes":1,"total_comments":0}
